intro: Gomphostemma dentatum, commonly known as the toothed gomphostemma, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Menispermaceae family, which includes climbing plants and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
